page.title: 10EARLY SETTLEMENT IN ACTON
page.content: {Palaeolithic Period} Three worked flints have been found in the old gravel pits. {Bronze Age} Crop marks revealed by aerial photo- graph show a pair of irregular round ditches which may have encircled a barrow or wooden henge southwest of Balsdon Hall on the slope below Hawks Grove. {Romano-British Period} The same photograph shows what appears to be a native farmstead within these ditches. {Roman Period} Traces of an east-west road may be seen along a minor road and hedge near School and Slough Farms. A north-south road crossed this near Bassetts Farm. Close by, a hand mill stone and a marble head of Roman origin have been found.
